abstract: An array of payment summary item objects that summarize the amount of the payment.
overview:
## Discussion

A typical transaction includes separate summary items for the order total, shipping cost, tax, and the grand total. See the following code for an example.

Apple Pay uses the last item in the `paymentSummaryItems` array as the grand total for the purchase shown in the example in [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKPaymentRequest/paymentSummaryItems]. The [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKPaymentAuthorizationViewController] class displays this item differently than the rest of the summary items. As a result, there are additional requirements placed on both its amount and its label.

Your payment processor might have additional requirements, such as a minimum or maximum payment amount.

In iOS 15 and later you can create three different types of payment summary items:

Setting the payment summary items:

items.description: Initializes and returns a summary item with the given label and amount.
items.name: init(label:amount:)

items.description: An object that defines a summary item in a payment request, taxes, discounts, shipping, a grand total, and the like.
items.name: PKPaymentSummaryItem

items.description: An object that defines a summary item for a payment that occurs repeatedly at a specified interval, such as a subscription.
items.name: PKRecurringPaymentSummaryItem

items.description: An object that defines a summary item for a payment that occurs at a later date, such as a pre-order.
items.name: PKDeferredPaymentSummaryItem

title: paymentSummaryItems
